node.title: Swimming near sharks in freezing water might sound horrifying but for Ross Frylinck, it was life-changing
node.alt: A deep underwater image of silouetted man diving through clear, green water and kelp.
node.description: The South African filmmakerÂ says his friend, creator of My Octopus Teacher Craig Foster, taught him that cold water swimming can seriously impact your life.
node.content:
["Ross Frylinck has swum at the same place every day for the last ten years.", "There, it's not the prevalence of sharks that poses the greatest challenge\u00a0nor the wave action. It's the freezing cold water.", "In False Bay, south of Cape Town,\u00a0South Africa, the ocean temperature gets down to eight or nine degrees Celsius. Ross not only swims there, he does it without a wetsuit, following the advice of his good friend Craig Foster, creator of the Oscar award-winning documentary My Octopus Teacher.", "When Craig first spruiked the mental and physical benefits of a daily swim in cold waters, Ross, a filmmaker, writer and free diver, was sceptical.", "", "
Filmmaker Craig Foster spruiked the benefits of cold-water swimming to\u00a0Ross Frylinck.\u00a0(Supplied\u00a0)
", "In the part of the world where the two friends live, \"it's totally unusual for someone to go diving without a wetsuit \u2026 and just crazy. I couldn't believe someone would do this for any reason,\" Ross tells ABC RN's Life Matters.", "He describes his friend as \"an extremist\" with a gentle capacity for persuasion;\u00a0\"a great, soft power where he can talk me into doing anything\".", "Ross gave in to his friend's advice \u2013 not for the last time \u2013 and in doing so began a path to a closer connection to the nature around him\u00a0and to an experience in the ocean so profound, it still affects him, a decade on.", "\"It's pretty hard to explain or justify any of this, you're just going to have to take my word,\" he says.", "\"But for the very first time in my life, I was awake and everything else had been kind of a dream.\"", "
What nature can teach us about ourselves
", "Ross says when he first observed his friend Craig's comfort in the environment, he was struck by the contrast with his own comfort levels.", "", "
Cold-water swimming every day has taught Ross Frylinck to see the world in a different way.(Supplied)
", "For example, when they were diving and encountered a massive great white shark, Ross's\u00a0instinct was to immediately flee the scene. \"I was obviously terrified,\" he says.", "Craig, however, wanted to stay in the water to observe the animal. \"He said, 'This is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to see a great white shark in the in the wild, they're even rarer than Bengal tigers',\" Ross recalls.", "", "
There is a high prevalence of great white sharks in the South African coast where Ross regularly swims.\u00a0(Supplied: Tom Foster)
", "They did stay and observed the animal, emerging from the experience unscathed. It was one of many steps Ross took towards forming a closer relationship with the ocean\u00a0and its inhabitants.", "But he began to feel a personal shift, too.", "Craig had described to Ross a feeling of \"wilderness rapture\" in the water, which he never quite understood. Again, he was sceptical of his friend.", "", "
Today Ross feels at home in the ocean and all its creatures, but it wasn't always that way.(Supplied)
", "Then, one day Ross was in a slightly different part of the ocean, swimming on his own. He was on the west coast of Cape Town, where the water is even colder than his usual swimming spot.", "A huge school of fish swam up to him and circled him. \"In marine protected areas, these fish are very calm around people because they're not hunted\u00a0and they're actually incredibly friendly,\" Ross says.", "\"I was just totally absorbed in this experience of these beautiful fish just swimming all around me; [I was] quite enchanted.\"", "Then the cold started to bite, and he returned to the beach. Sitting there in the sun to warm up, Ross says, \"the strangest thing happened, [which] hasn't happened since\".", "\"And then these waves of flames just came up through my body and straight out of the top of my head. And it was an awakening. I just knew that I was awake now for the first time.\"", "Ross acknowledges it might sound hard to believe.", "\"But when I explained the experience to Craig, he was like, 'Yeah, that's it. That's exactly the experience I'm talking about'.\"", "
A valve to the world was opened
", "Ross and Craig have written about their friendship and the impact of cold-water swimming on their lives\u00a0in their book Underwater Wild.", "In it, Ross says, they argue that \"nature is a kind of mirror of one's own psyche\".", "\"And that time in wilderness, especially with a close friend, can let you look into this mirror and see aspects of your own psyche that are normally hidden to oneself,\" he says.", "", "
Ross's connection with nature\u00a0made him reflect on his relationship with his\u00a0father\u00a0and\u00a0his\u00a0son.(Supplied)
", "Ross says the feeling of awakening \u2013 which lasted a few days before dissipating \u2013 opened him up to experience his surroundings in a completely different way.", "\"I noticed for the first time how incredibly alive and beautiful the world was,\" he says.", "\"The rocks, little rock pools, the animals in the rock pools. Everything was alive and not separate.\"", "Ross related to a description by author Aldous Huxley about the ego as\u00a0\"a reducing valve that blocks out the magnificence of the world\".", "\"It was just like that valve just opened,\" Ross says.", "\"It's that simple. Whatever is reducing the inputs just opened. And it was the most amazing experience.\"", "When Ross talks about other significant life experiences \u2013 having a son, for example, reconnecting with his estranged father or attempting to bring three generations of his family together for the first time \u2013 the water is always present, like a scaffold holding his story together.", "Ross's son was born three months' premature\u00a0and they were very worried the baby wouldn't survive.", "\"It was a very painful and traumatic time for myself and my wife,\" he says.", "That's when he started diving with Craig, and started to understand more about the profound effects of being in the ocean that\u00a0his friend had spoken about.", "\"All these feelings were coming up,\" Ross says, of those early days when he was first swimming with Craig.", "Soon after that, on a whim, Ross searched social media to find his father, who had abandoned his\u00a0family 30 years earlier.", "\"I wondered what had happened to him and he had a grandson and I just wanted to connect,\" Ross says.", "The subsequent reunion was exciting and surreal, although the relationship eventually soured. Throughout, the kelp forests Ross was swimming in daily were there, consistent and comforting.", "And though the epiphanous feeling of awakening went away, the impact \u2013 and its lesson \u2013 have remained.", "Ross says he's learnt there's \"an interface\" with nature \"that is available to so many of us, but we don't enter that space for whatever reason\".", "\"And I think that's the invite of wilderness, that we enter to learn about ourselves and to unburden. It's available and it's free\u00a0and it's incredibly accessible, if only you will choose to enter.\""]
